children.subject: The basic courses in the EECS upper division would be 128 (which you may have already taken as ME 134), 192, 106A/B. I’ve only taken 128 out of that set, so I’ll let someone more qualified chime in in the student answer!

history.content: This is super late, but I did mechE with an EECS minor and took 128, 106AB, 188. 189 would also be a good idea, as would one or two of the mechE/EECS graduate controls classes. Tbh MechE doesn't teach robotics  particularly well imo (at least the software/algorithms). 106A/B was much better at that. I also wish that I'd taken 126, since I've suffered a bit in my stochastic controls classes from a lack of probability background.

This is super late, but I did mechE with an EECS minor and took 128, 106AB, 188. 189 would also be a good idea, as would one or two of the mechE/EECS graduate controls classes. Tbh MechE doesn't teach robotics  particularly well imo (at least the software/algorithms). 106A/B was much better at that.

I am pursuing an EECS minor as a MechE major; I need some advice for my upperdivs! I hope to work in some application of robotics and controls, and I think a little EECS knowledge will help add onto the dynamics, feedback control, and design from MechE. So far CS100, CS170, CS188, CS189 seem like all good CS choices, but I don't have enough knowledge to know which would be most useful for my situation. As far as EE goes, all I know is that I probably don't need the robotics courses as an ME. Thanks for the help!
history.subject: Best EECS upperdivs for mechatronics/controls?
